intro: Phyllorkis tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
